message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.IT, cs.CE

The paper discusses the integration of mobile edge computing (MEC) into virtualized cellular networks with machine-to-machine (M2M) communications. This involves optimizing computing resource allocation, improving computing capability, and reducing energy consumption. These topics are closely related to the field of computer networks and communication systems, which are covered by the arXiv sub-categories cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) and cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). Additionally, the paper proposes a partially observable Markov decision process (POMDP) to minimize system cost, which falls under the sub-category cs.SY (Systems and Control). The paper also discusses quality of service (QoS) requirements, which is a topic covered by the sub-category cs.IT (Information Theory). Finally, the paper introduces software-defined networking (SDN) to deal with diverse protocols and standards, which is a topic covered by the sub-category cs.CE (Computing and Engineering).
